conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted whether it will flow into container D or E.
Stream A is predicted to flow into Container D.
Stream B is predicted to flow into Container D.
Stream C is predicted to flow into Container E.
The angles and positions of the baffles guide each incoming stream down a specific zig-zag path.
Following the paths shows that streams from A and B are directed toward the left-hand exit.
Following the paths shows that the stream from C is guided toward the right-hand exit.
